A Grifolapine is a monster found in the Polypore Dungeon (fairy ring code BIP) on the third level. It requires a Slayer level of 88 to kill, and 60 Magic for the player to receive as a Slayer assignment.

Grifolapines have similar drops to Grifolaroos but have much better drop rates for grifolic flakes, the sought-after item to create the grifolic armour set. In addition, they are the only monster that drops the grifolic wand and grifolic shield.

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.

    • Achievements[edit | edit source]

    • Fenkenstrain's Monster ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Morytania.
      • Grifolic shield drop
      • Grifolic wand drop

    Update history[edit | edit source]

    This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
    • patch 7 March 2016 (Update):
      • Grifolapines have had their combat stats rebalanced (weakened variant).
    • patch 2 November 2015 (Update):
      • Now deals damage correctly with ranged and magic attacks.
    • update 28 November 2011 (Update):
      • Added to game.

    Trivia[edit | edit source]

    • A grifolapine is shown in the RuneScape Cinematic Trailer. It doesn't do anything except stare at Ozan.
    • Grifolapines are one of the few monsters in RuneScape that will never move from their spawn point, the others being the Spiritual mages (Bandos), and Ancient mages.
    • Their name and examine text could be a reference to porcupines. 
    • As of 1 February 2018, the highest kill count for these monsters was 259,437 kills, shared with all polypore creatures.[1]
      • This had increased to 351,360 by 6 May 2018.[2]
